channel.title: Path specified
channel.description:
Im really new and would like help. It says that it cannot find the path specified when i try to run it. What should i change?
@echo off color 0a title Project Gecko "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\java.exe" -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause

Read full topic

item.title: Path specified
item.dc:creator: @cdoggy cdoggy
item.description:
@cdoggy wrote:

To put it all into one:

Download Java for Windows x86 (assuming you have 32bit). Run and install Java.

Set your path variable if you plan to compile anything: http://www.java.com/en/download/help/path.xml

Navigate into your program files, find the java folder and then navigate into the bin. Click the top address bar, copy the entire path to the bin folder, and replace the path in the .bat.

Save the file and close it. Run the .bat and there should be no issues.

Read full topic

item.title: Path specified
item.dc:creator: @devenb123 devenb123
item.description:
@devenb123 wrote:

Here ill make this a bit simpler…

@echo off color 0a title Project Gecko "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\java.exe" -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause

that is yours… this is what the file is grabbing… :\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23 now. google java jdk and install java jdk update 7. now you should change the entire code to this

@echo off color 0a title Project Gecko "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\java.exe" -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause

Hope this helped.

SIDE NOTE: Good luck. I see you are a new coder and i hope to see you active on these forums. People here are very helpful and will help you on your way.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97

@tyb97 wrote:

item.title: Path specified
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

@echo off
color 0a
title Project Gecko
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_01\bin\java.exe” -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
pause
Change the 1.7.0_01 to your JDK located in your java folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Path specified
item.dc:creator: @skillingman8 skillingman8
item.description:
@skillingman8 wrote:

The reason it is saying that as other posters said is because you have to leed the compiler to you’re java folder.

If you have a 32 bit computer you’re file will be here,
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_01\bin

If you have a 64 bit computer you’re file will be here,
C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_01\bin

To find out if you’re computer is 32 or 64 bit click the run button,
right click computer then click properties
now look down the properties list tell you find it saying 32 bit or 64 bit

Read full topic
